quest.name: It Takes a Village
journal: Relieved as he is that you and Konogg are safe, the dig site chief wishes to know of Anogg's fate.

You tell the dig site chief of what transpired within the tower. The truth of Anogg's fate seems almost too much for him to bear, and he requests that you be the one to inform Konogg─and prevent his doing anything rash.

An anguished Konogg accepts the letter from Anogg and tearfully tasks you with a delivery in turn─that of a watch to be entrusted to the dig site chief. The young dwarf found it amongst the rubble and made all the necessary repairs, but cannot bring himself to return to the village to see it into its owner's hands.

Though the chief is pleased to have his wife's treasured family heirloom back in one piece, he finds it suspicious that Konogg failed to return along with it. He dashes off in a panic─presumably toward where you left Konogg in the tunnels.

As the chief suspected, Konogg is gone by the time the two of you reach the tunnels, leaving a note of farewell behind. Feeling that the twins' respective departures from Komra were ultimately the fault of its less-than-supportive people, he hurries off to gather the villagers, that they might know the consequences of their behavior.

The villagers gathered, the dig site chief begins to explain the situation. No sooner does he say that the danger has passed, however, than do the villagers once again revive their debate over who ought to be punished for it having been present in the first place. Stymied and more than a bit frustrated with the lot of them, the chief asks that you speak with each individual and try to bring them around.
You speak with the villagers. Though they remain a stubborn bunch, some seem at least perturbed, if not convinced, by your arguments.

For a moment, it appears that the villagers may see reason─but the crowd soon turns their wayward ire on Glagg for his role in starting the witch hunt. This is the final straw for the dig site chief, who tells them frankly that everyone present is in the wrong before running off once again.

When you find the dig site chief once again, he is much calmer. In spite of everything, he remains determined to rebuild Komra. In addition to your own offer to aid in this endeavor comes a similar offer from a heretofore cowardly villager trying─much like the chief himself─to do the right thing, whatever that may be.
objectives: Speak with Konogg in the excavation tunnels.
Deliver the repaired watch to the dig site chief.
Speak to the dig site chief in the excavation tunnels.
Wait for the chief to return.
Speak with the dig site chief.
Speak with the dig site chief in Komra.

dialogue.name: DWARFMASTER03671
dialogue.text: So... What happened in there?

dialogue.name: DWARFMASTER03671
dialogue.text: ...Well, I won't pretend I understood half of that. Can't say metaphysics is my area of expertise. Still, I knew that those androids in white and their weird orb were trouble.

dialogue.name: DWARFMASTER03671
dialogue.text: And you're saying that you gave 'em what for, so they won't be coming back. Which is good...right?

dialogue.name: DWARFMASTER03671
dialogue.text: Glad to hear it. Thanks for risking your neck for us.

dialogue.name: DWARFMASTER03671
dialogue.text: Where's Anogg, though? And your android friends, for that matter? Seems like they should've come back with you...

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: I'm sorry.

dialogue.name: DWARFMASTER03671
dialogue.text: No, she... But why!?

dialogue.name: DWARFMASTER03671
dialogue.text: It just...don't seem fair.

dialogue.name: DWARFMASTER03671
dialogue.text: I was holding out hope, you know? That everyone would be fine, and life would go back to normal.

dialogue.name: DWARFMASTER03671
dialogue.text: I should have known better, sure, but...

dialogue.name: DWARFMASTER03671
dialogue.text: <sigh> Someone will need to tell the villagers. Again.

dialogue.name: DWARFMASTER03671
dialogue.text: As for Konogg─can you speak with him? I managed to talk him out of running back in there as soon as he woke up, but this... It might be better coming from you. Or maybe I'm just a coward.

dialogue.name: POD
dialogue.text: Alert: The tower can no longer be detected.

dialogue.name: KONOGG
dialogue.text: You're back! But where's everyone else?

dialogue.name: KONOGG
dialogue.text: No... She can't be gone. She wouldn't leave me forever!

dialogue.name: KONOGG
dialogue.text: Because if she did, I'd... There'd be no one left who...

dialogue.name: KONOGG
dialogue.text: A-A letter? From Anogg?

dialogue.name: KONOGG
dialogue.text:
“Konogg,
I've been to another world. I've seen it...”

dialogue.name: KONOGG
dialogue.text: Wh-What does she mean? She...the world...they're “constructs”?

dialogue.name: KONOGG
dialogue.text: That's hardly a reason to run off on her own! She could've...<sniff>...I would've...

dialogue.name: KONOGG
dialogue.text: Um. I...I have something I need to do. So...

dialogue.name: KONOGG
dialogue.text: That watch belongs to the chief's wife. I found it when I was clearing rubble earlier.

dialogue.name: KONOGG
dialogue.text: It was broken, but I...<sniff>...I went ahead and fixed it. She'd probably like it back, so can you give it to the chief for me?

dialogue.name: Q2
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: I suppose.

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: Wouldn't they be happier if you delivered it yourself?

dialogue.name: KONOGG
dialogue.text: Thank you. Right now, I... I'm sorry.

dialogue.name: KONOGG
dialogue.text: I...can't. I need to─ Never mind. I'm sorry.

dialogue.name: KONOGG
dialogue.text: I appreciate all that you've done for us. If only I was as strong as you are...

dialogue.name: KONOGG
dialogue.text: Maybe someday.

dialogue.name: KONOGG
dialogue.text: If the chief asks, tell him not to worry.

dialogue.name: DWARFMASTER03671
dialogue.text: How did it go?

dialogue.name: DWARFMASTER03671
dialogue.text: Eh? Something for the missus?

dialogue.name: DWARFMASTER03671
dialogue.text: Wicked white, we thought this was gone for good! She'll be glad to have it back. It's all she has left of her parents.

dialogue.name: DWARFMASTER03671
dialogue.text: Why didn't Konogg come in person, though? He must know we'd want to thank him.

dialogue.name: DWARFMASTER03671
dialogue.text: No... Not him too!

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: It seems that you once again have cause to comfort a distraught dwarf...

dialogue.name: DWARFMASTER03671
dialogue.text: He left a letter of farewell.

dialogue.name: DWARFMASTER03671
dialogue.text: He's gone.

dialogue.name: DWARFMASTER03671
dialogue.text: I wish I could've done something... Anything.

dialogue.name: DWARFMASTER03671
dialogue.text: We've lost them both, and it's our own fault. We drove them to this.

dialogue.name: DWARFMASTER03671
dialogue.text: This can't be right...

dialogue.name: Q3
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A3
dialogue.text: What do you plan to do about it?

dialogue.name: A3
dialogue.text: What is “right,” in the end?

dialogue.name: DWARFMASTER03671
dialogue.text: I don't know what I should do. I don't know how to make things right, but...

dialogue.name: DWARFMASTER03671
dialogue.text: I don't know, but this ain't it.

dialogue.name: DWARFMASTER03671
dialogue.text: The villagers need to understand that we can't keep on like this.

dialogue.name: DWARFMASTER03671
dialogue.text: They might be better listeners now that they don't have to live in fear anymore─if they can believe that's the case, that is. Would you mind sticking around? It'll seem more credible coming from the both of us.

dialogue.name: Q4
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A4
dialogue.text: I'm here for as long as you need me.

dialogue.name: A4
dialogue.text: How much does this position pay?

dialogue.name: DWARFMASTER03671
dialogue.text: I knew you would be. You're always willing to do what needs doing.

dialogue.name: DWARFMASTER03671
dialogue.text: I'm ready to do my part, too. Wait here.

dialogue.name: DWARFMASTER03671
dialogue.text: Ha! That's right─took you for an aspiring gate guard at first, didn't I?

dialogue.name: DWARFMASTER03671
dialogue.text: And we've been nothing but trouble to you since. Not sure there's enough money in all of Komra to compensate you at this point...

dialogue.name: Q5
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A5
dialogue.text: It's fine. I'm happy to help.

dialogue.name: A5
dialogue.text: I also accept eternal gratitude and the right to ominously reference “debts to be repaid.”

dialogue.name: DWARFMASTER03671
dialogue.text: It's a deal, then. But I do hope we can pay you back someday.

dialogue.name: DWARFMASTER03671
dialogue.text: For now, wait here─I'll get the villagers.

dialogue.name: DWARFMASTER03671
dialogue.text: Now that you're all here, I have an important announcement: Forename has put an end to those machines and their plot.

dialogue.name: DWARFMASTER03671
dialogue.text: That means the danger's passed, but more importantly, that it's time we look to the future. We'll need to come together─

dialogue.name: GLAGG
dialogue.text: Hold your ironfrogs! Even if those things are gone, this ain't over.

dialogue.name: GLAGG
dialogue.text: The culprit needs to be brought to justice. How can you expect people to move forward if we don't set an example?

dialogue.name: VILLAGERA03954
dialogue.text: That's right─we want to see consequences! Death! Mutilation!

dialogue.name: DWARFMASTER03671
dialogue.text: Do you really!?

dialogue.name: DWARFMASTER03671
dialogue.text: We need to talk them down, or we'll never get anywhere with this. Bloodthirsty bastards...

dialogue.name: DWARFMASTER03671
dialogue.text: You can't force one person to shoulder the blame for all of this! Some things are bigger than all of us, Glagg.

dialogue.name: GLAGG
dialogue.text: Folk'll never accept that. It just ain't a satisfyin' conclusion.

dialogue.name: VILLAGERA03954
dialogue.text: The sooner we do away with the culprit, the sooner we can all relax. You know I'm right─Glagg thinks so too!

dialogue.name: Q6
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A6
dialogue.text: You'd change your tune if the finger were pointed at you.

dialogue.name: A6
dialogue.text: The blame could just as easily fall on someone you love.

dialogue.name: VILLAGERA03954
dialogue.text: You wouldn't dare accuse me! Everyone knows I'm innocent.

dialogue.name: VILLAGERA03954
dialogue.text: D-Don't they?

dialogue.name: VILLAGERA03954
dialogue.text: Ha! That ploy won't work on me. I don't have anyone to worry about. No family, no friends, no lovers...

dialogue.name: VILLAGERA03954
dialogue.text: I don't...have anyone.

dialogue.name: VILLAGERB03954
dialogue.text: All we need is one or two people to take the blame. Then the rest of us can get back to our normal lives.

dialogue.name: Q7
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A7
dialogue.text: You'd build your life by destroying others'?

dialogue.name: A7
dialogue.text: Are you planning to volunteer?

dialogue.name: VILLAGERB03954
dialogue.text: Wouldn't you? The way I see it, anyone here would throw you to the eaters in a heartbeat for their own gain. You, or me...

dialogue.name: VILLAGERB03954
dialogue.text: Those backstabbers!

dialogue.name: VILLAGERB03954
dialogue.text: Why should I? I've done nothing wrong!

dialogue.name: VILLAGERB03954
dialogue.text: No, not... Not a single thing...

dialogue.name: VILLAGERC03954
dialogue.text: Justice should be swift and decisive, I say. Nothing so satisfying as the headsman's axe coming down.

dialogue.name: Q8
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A8
dialogue.text: Justice isn't about personal satisfaction.

dialogue.name: A8
dialogue.text: And if it comes down on the wrong person?

dialogue.name: VILLAGERC03954
dialogue.text: Why shouldn't it be? Punish one person and everyone else feels better for it. That's justification enough.

dialogue.name: VILLAGERC03954
dialogue.text: Anything would be better than feeling like this...

dialogue.name: VILLAGERC03954
dialogue.text: At least we'll be able to put this mess behind us. Forget the whole thing.

dialogue.name: VILLAGERC03954
dialogue.text: I can't think about it anymore. I just can't.

dialogue.name: VILLAGERD03954
dialogue.text: I-I only need to do what Glagg says, right? Then he won't blame me...and whatever happens, it won't be my fault.

dialogue.name: Q9
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A9
dialogue.text: You think that will protect you?

dialogue.name: A9
dialogue.text: No. This is a choice you must make yourself.

dialogue.name: VILLAGERD03954
dialogue.text: W-Won't it? I haven't done anything wrong...

dialogue.name: VILLAGERD03954
dialogue.text: I haven't done...anything.

dialogue.name: VILLAGERD03954
dialogue.text: B-But then it'll be my responsibility─no matter what happens!

dialogue.name: VILLAGERD03954
dialogue.text: Someone else... Someone else should be the one...

dialogue.name: VILLAGERE03954
dialogue.text: The most prudent course is to cooperate with Glagg and rid the village of the guilty party. Then everything will be as it was.

dialogue.name: Q10
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A10
dialogue.text: Will it?

dialogue.name: A10
dialogue.text: Is it really “prudent” to follow harm with cruelty?

dialogue.name: VILLAGERE03954
dialogue.text: Of course it will. It has to be.

dialogue.name: VILLAGERE03954
dialogue.text: Believe me, if there were a better way...

dialogue.name: VILLAGERE03954
dialogue.text: If it weren't, Glagg wouldn't have suggested it. He's the elder. He knows how these things work. If not, then...

dialogue.name: VILLAGERE03954
dialogue.text: No, don't be ridiculous.

dialogue.name: VILLAGERA03954
dialogue.text: It's better this way, trust me. You do trust me...right?

dialogue.name: VILLAGERB03954
dialogue.text: I'm right─you'll see. You'll all see...

dialogue.name: VILLAGERC03954
dialogue.text: ...Forget I said anything.

dialogue.name: VILLAGERD03954
dialogue.text: You don't understand─I can't be h-held accountable...

dialogue.name: DWARFMASTER03671
dialogue.text: Well, they've settled down a bit, at least. Thanks for that.

dialogue.name: GLAGG
dialogue.text: <sniff> Still sober, eh? Then I'll ask─what do you reckon we should do?

dialogue.name: Q11
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A11
dialogue.text: Stop this before it's too late.

dialogue.name: A11
dialogue.text: Whatever doesn't involve me hearing everyone's opinions again...

dialogue.name: A11
dialogue.text: How should I know better than any of you?

dialogue.name: VILLAGERA03954
dialogue.text: Maybe the outsider's right. We'll never agree on who should take the blame for the attack. Which means the real problem is...Glagg!

dialogue.name: VILLAGERC03954
dialogue.text: I did feel a lot more confident before he started telling us to “listen to other perspectives”...

dialogue.name: VILLAGERB03954
dialogue.text: He's been trying to turn us against each other, but he's the elder here. Shouldn't he have seen our village's fiery destruction by skybound machines coming?

dialogue.name: DWARFMASTER03671
dialogue.text: What? No!

dialogue.name: DWARFMASTER03671
dialogue.text: No one could've foreseen this. No matter how wise they are, or how hard they try...no one's right every time!

dialogue.name: DWARFMASTER03671
dialogue.text: We've all made mistakes here, believe me. Anogg, Konogg, Glagg, the whole lot of you...and me. All of us!

dialogue.name: DWARFMASTER03671
dialogue.text: We failed each other.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Alas, there he goes again.

dialogue.name: VILLAGERA03954
dialogue.text: Er...now what?

dialogue.name: VILLAGERB03954
dialogue.text: Me? Make a mistake? Never.

dialogue.name: VILLAGERC03954
dialogue.text: Well? Don't let him get away!

dialogue.name: VILLAGERD03954
dialogue.text: If... If doing nothing is just as wrong, then maybe it wouldn't be so bad to make my own choices...

dialogue.name: VILLAGERE03954
dialogue.text: Now that's just cowardly.

dialogue.name: GLAGG
dialogue.text: Are my ears goin', or am I bein' insulted left and right?

dialogue.name: DWARFMASTER03671
dialogue.text: Lali-sorry you had to see that-ho. I may not be cut out for public speaking...

dialogue.name: DWARFMASTER03671
dialogue.text: I won't give up on putting Komra back together, though─in whatever way I can.

dialogue.name: DWARFMASTER03671
dialogue.text: I don't know what we should have done, but...there's nothing for it but to try and do better. Day by day, moment by moment.

dialogue.name: Q12
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A12
dialogue.text: Day by day, moment by moment.

dialogue.name: A12
dialogue.text: Need some help with that? 'Course you do.

dialogue.name: DWARFMASTER03671
dialogue.text: I admit, I feel better knowing you'll be around.

dialogue.name: VILLAGERD03954
dialogue.text: (-???-)P-Pardon me...

dialogue.name: VILLAGERD03954
dialogue.text: I, er...I was thinking about what you said, and I realized I probably haven't been the most helpful...

dialogue.name: VILLAGERD03954
dialogue.text: I want─ I'm choosing to try harder, from now on. So if you need another pair of hands...

dialogue.name: DWARFMASTER03671
dialogue.text: You're more than welcome to join us.

dialogue.name: DWARFMASTER03671
dialogue.text: Though I'd say we're all past due for a little breather, after all that's happened. Take a rest! Chief's orders.

dialogue.name: VILLAGERD03954
dialogue.text: Understood! I'll be just over there, then. With my thoughts. Yes. Not a problem...

dialogue.name: DWARFMASTER03671
dialogue.text: He's a little odd, but he's got the spirit. I look forward to putting the both of you to work─at your earliest convenience, of course.

obj.n: Komra Wasn't Built in a Day
